p: The hydroethanolic extract of N. sativa (0.08â€‰g daily) on sulfur mustard exposed guinea pigs caused the reduction of tracheal responsiveness to methacholine as well as total and differential WBC count in treated compared to untreated animals [ 124]. Similarly, N. sativa significantly decreased tracheal responsiveness and lung inflammation including the percentage of eosinophil and monocyte, neutrophil, and lymphocyte number in guinea pigs 14 days after sulfur mustard exposure [ 118].
